info.description:
AWS Firewall Manager

This is the AWS Firewall Manager API Reference. This guide is for developers who need detailed information about the AWS Firewall Manager API actions, data types, and errors. For detailed information about AWS Firewall Manager features, see the AWS Firewall Manager Developer Guide.
info.title: Firewall Management Service

post.description:
Sets the AWS Firewall Manager administrator account. AWS Firewall Manager must be associated with the master account your AWS organization or associated with a member account that has the appropriate permissions. If the account ID that you submit is not an AWS Organizations master account, AWS Firewall Manager will set the appropriate permissions for the given member account.

The account that you associate with AWS Firewall Manager is called the AWS Firewall Manager administrator account.

AdminAccount.description: The AWS account ID to associate with AWS Firewall Manager as the AWS Firewall Manager administrator account. This can be an AWS Organizations master account or a member account. For more information about AWS Organizations and master accounts, see Managing the AWS Accounts in Your Organization.

post.description: Deletes an AWS Firewall Manager association with the IAM role and the Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS) topic that is used to record AWS Firewall Manager SNS logs.
Permanently deletes an AWS Firewall Manager policy.

DeleteAllPolicyResources.description: If True, the request will also delete all web ACLs in this policy. Associated resources will no longer be protected by web ACLs in this policy.

PolicyId.description: The ID of the policy that you want to delete. PolicyId is returned by PutPolicy and by ListPolicies.

post.description: Disassociates the account that has been set as the AWS Firewall Manager administrator account. To set a different account as the administrator account, you must submit an AssociateAdminAccount request .
Returns the AWS Organizations master account that is associated with AWS Firewall Manager as the AWS Firewall Manager administrator.

AdminAccount.description: The AWS account that is set as the AWS Firewall Manager administrator.

RoleStatus.description: The status of the AWS account that you set as the AWS Firewall Manager administrator.

post.description: Returns detailed compliance information about the specified member account. Details include resources that are in and out of compliance with the specified policy. Resources are considered non-compliant if the specified policy has not been applied to them.

PolicyComplianceDetail.description: Information about the resources and the policy that you specified in the GetComplianceDetail request.

EvaluationLimitExceeded.description: Indicates if over 100 resources are non-compliant with the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

ExpiredAt.description: A time stamp that indicates when the returned information should be considered out-of-date.

IssueInfoMap.description: Details about problems with dependent services, such as AWS WAF or AWS Config, that are causing a resource to be non-compliant. The details include the name of the dependent service and the error message received that indicates the problem with the service.

PolicyId.description: The ID of the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

PolicyOwner.description: The AWS account that created the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

Violators.description: An array of resources that are not protected by the policy.

items.description: Details of the resource that is not protected by the policy.

ResourceType.description: The resource type. This is in the format shown in AWS Resource Types Reference. Valid values are AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer or AWS::CloudFront::Distribution.

ViolationReason.description: The reason that the resource is not protected by the policy.

MemberAccount.description: The AWS account that owns the resources that you want to get the details for.

PolicyId.description: The ID of the policy that you want to get the details for. PolicyId is returned by PutPolicy and by ListPolicies.

post.description: Returns information about the Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS) topic that is used to record AWS Firewall Manager SNS logs.

SnsRoleName.description: The IAM role that is used by AWS Firewall Manager to record activity to SNS.

SnsTopicArn.description: The SNS topic that records AWS Firewall Manager activity.

post.description: Returns information about the specified AWS Firewall Manager policy.

Policy.description: Information about the specified AWS Firewall Manager policy.

ExcludeMap.description:
Specifies the AWS account IDs to exclude from the policy. The IncludeMap values are evaluated first, with all the appropriate account IDs added to the policy. Then the accounts listed in ExcludeMap are removed, resulting in the final list of accounts to add to the policy.

The key to the map is ACCOUNT. For example, a valid ExcludeMap would be {“ACCOUNT” : [“accountID1”, “accountID2”]}.

ExcludeResourceTags.description: If set to True, resources with the tags that are specified in the ResourceTag array are not protected by the policy. If set to False, and the ResourceTag array is not null, only resources with the specified tags are associated with the policy.

IncludeMap.description:
Specifies the AWS account IDs to include in the policy. If IncludeMap is null, all accounts in the organization in AWS Organizations are included in the policy. If IncludeMap is not null, only values listed in IncludeMap are included in the policy.

The key to the map is ACCOUNT. For example, a valid IncludeMap would be {“ACCOUNT” : [“accountID1”, “accountID2”]}.

PolicyId.description: The ID of the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

PolicyName.description: The friendly name of the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

PolicyUpdateToken.description: A unique identifier for each update to the policy. When issuing a PutPolicy request, the PolicyUpdateToken in the request must match the PolicyUpdateToken of the current policy version. To get the PolicyUpdateToken of the current policy version, use a GetPolicy request.

RemediationEnabled.description: Indicates if the policy should be automatically applied to new resources.

items.description: The resource tags that AWS Firewall Manager uses to determine if a particular resource should be included or excluded from protection by the AWS Firewall Manager policy. Tags enable you to categorize your AWS resources in different ways, for example, by purpose, owner, or environment. Each tag consists of a key and an optional value, both of which you define. Tags are combined with an "OR." That is, if you add more than one tag, if any of the tags matches, the resource is considered a match for the include or exclude. Working with Tag Editor.

ResourceType.description: The type of resource to protect with the policy, either an Application Load Balancer or a CloudFront distribution. This is in the format shown in AWS Resource Types Reference. Valid values are AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer or AWS::CloudFront::Distribution.

SecurityServicePolicyData.description: Details about the security service that is being used to protect the resources.

ManagedServiceData.description:
Details about the service. This contains WAF data in JSON format, as shown in the following example:

ManagedServiceData": "{\"type\": \"WAF\", \"ruleGroups\": [{\"id\": \"12345678-1bcd-9012-efga-0987654321ab\", \"overrideAction\" : {\"type\": \"COUNT\"}}], \"defaultAction\": {\"type\": \"BLOCK\"}}

Type.description: The service that the policy is using to protect the resources. This value is WAF.

PolicyArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the specified policy.

PolicyId.description: The ID of the AWS Firewall Manager policy that you want the details for.

post.description: Returns an array of PolicyComplianceStatus objects in the response. Use PolicyComplianceStatus to get a summary of which member accounts are protected by the specified policy.

NextToken.description: If you have more PolicyComplianceStatus objects than the number that you specified for MaxResults in the request, the response includes a NextToken value. To list more PolicyComplianceStatus objects, submit another ListComplianceStatus request, and specify the NextToken value from the response in the NextToken value in the next request.

items.description: Indicates whether the account is compliant with the specified policy. An account is considered non-compliant if it includes resources that are not protected by the policy.
Describes the compliance status for the account. An account is considered non-compliant if it includes resources that are not protected by the specified policy.

ComplianceStatus.description: Describes an AWS account's compliance with the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

EvaluationLimitExceeded.description: Indicates that over 100 resources are non-compliant with the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

ViolatorCount.description: Number of resources that are non-compliant with the specified policy. A resource is considered non-compliant if it is not associated with the specified policy.

IssueInfoMap.description: Details about problems with dependent services, such as AWS WAF or AWS Config, that are causing a resource to be non-compliant. The details include the name of the dependent service and the error message received that indicates the problem with the service.

LastUpdated.description: Time stamp of the last update to the EvaluationResult objects.

PolicyId.description: The ID of the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

PolicyName.description: The friendly name of the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

PolicyOwner.description: The AWS account that created the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

MaxResults.description: Specifies the number of PolicyComplianceStatus objects that you want AWS Firewall Manager to return for this request. If you have more PolicyComplianceStatus objects than the number that you specify for MaxResults, the response includes a NextToken value that you can use to get another batch of PolicyComplianceStatus objects.

NextToken.description: If you specify a value for MaxResults and you have more PolicyComplianceStatus objects than the number that you specify for MaxResults, AWS Firewall Manager returns a NextToken value in the response that allows you to list another group of PolicyComplianceStatus objects. For the second and subsequent ListComplianceStatus requests, specify the value of NextToken from the previous response to get information about another batch of PolicyComplianceStatus objects.

PolicyId.description: The ID of the AWS Firewall Manager policy that you want the details for.

post.description:
Returns a MemberAccounts object that lists the member accounts in the administrator's AWS organization.

The ListMemberAccounts must be submitted by the account that is set as the AWS Firewall Manager administrator.

NextToken.description: If you have more member account IDs than the number that you specified for MaxResults in the request, the response includes a NextToken value. To list more IDs, submit another ListMemberAccounts request, and specify the NextToken value from the response in the NextToken value in the next request.

MaxResults.description: Specifies the number of member account IDs that you want AWS Firewall Manager to return for this request. If you have more IDs than the number that you specify for MaxResults, the response includes a NextToken value that you can use to get another batch of member account IDs.

NextToken.description: If you specify a value for MaxResults and you have more account IDs than the number that you specify for MaxResults, AWS Firewall Manager returns a NextToken value in the response that allows you to list another group of IDs. For the second and subsequent ListMemberAccountsRequest requests, specify the value of NextToken from the previous response to get information about another batch of member account IDs.

post.description: Returns an array of PolicySummary objects in the response.

NextToken.description: If you have more PolicySummary objects than the number that you specified for MaxResults in the request, the response includes a NextToken value. To list more PolicySummary objects, submit another ListPolicies request, and specify the NextToken value from the response in the NextToken value in the next request.

items.description: Details of the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

PolicyArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the specified policy.

PolicyId.description: The ID of the specified policy.

PolicyName.description: The friendly name of the specified policy.

RemediationEnabled.description: Indicates if the policy should be automatically applied to new resources.

ResourceType.description: The type of resource to protect with the policy, either an Application Load Balancer or a CloudFront distribution. This is in the format shown in AWS Resource Types Reference. Valid values are AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer or AWS::CloudFront::Distribution.

SecurityServiceType.description: The service that the policy is using to protect the resources. This value is WAF.

MaxResults.description: Specifies the number of PolicySummary objects that you want AWS Firewall Manager to return for this request. If you have more PolicySummary objects than the number that you specify for MaxResults, the response includes a NextToken value that you can use to get another batch of PolicySummary objects.

NextToken.description: If you specify a value for MaxResults and you have more PolicySummary objects than the number that you specify for MaxResults, AWS Firewall Manager returns a NextToken value in the response that allows you to list another group of PolicySummary objects. For the second and subsequent ListPolicies requests, specify the value of NextToken from the previous response to get information about another batch of PolicySummary objects.

post.description: Designates the IAM role and Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS) topic that AWS Firewall Manager uses to record SNS logs.

SnsRoleName.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that allows Amazon SNS to record AWS Firewall Manager activity.

SnsTopicArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic that collects notifications from AWS Firewall Manager.

post.description: Creates an AWS Firewall Manager policy.

Policy.description: The details of the AWS Firewall Manager policy that was created.

ExcludeMap.description:
Specifies the AWS account IDs to exclude from the policy. The IncludeMap values are evaluated first, with all the appropriate account IDs added to the policy. Then the accounts listed in ExcludeMap are removed, resulting in the final list of accounts to add to the policy.

The key to the map is ACCOUNT. For example, a valid ExcludeMap would be {“ACCOUNT” : [“accountID1”, “accountID2”]}.

ExcludeResourceTags.description: If set to True, resources with the tags that are specified in the ResourceTag array are not protected by the policy. If set to False, and the ResourceTag array is not null, only resources with the specified tags are associated with the policy.

IncludeMap.description:
Specifies the AWS account IDs to include in the policy. If IncludeMap is null, all accounts in the organization in AWS Organizations are included in the policy. If IncludeMap is not null, only values listed in IncludeMap are included in the policy.

The key to the map is ACCOUNT. For example, a valid IncludeMap would be {“ACCOUNT” : [“accountID1”, “accountID2”]}.

PolicyId.description: The ID of the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

PolicyName.description: The friendly name of the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

PolicyUpdateToken.description: A unique identifier for each update to the policy. When issuing a PutPolicy request, the PolicyUpdateToken in the request must match the PolicyUpdateToken of the current policy version. To get the PolicyUpdateToken of the current policy version, use a GetPolicy request.

RemediationEnabled.description: Indicates if the policy should be automatically applied to new resources.

items.description: The resource tags that AWS Firewall Manager uses to determine if a particular resource should be included or excluded from protection by the AWS Firewall Manager policy. Tags enable you to categorize your AWS resources in different ways, for example, by purpose, owner, or environment. Each tag consists of a key and an optional value, both of which you define. Tags are combined with an "OR." That is, if you add more than one tag, if any of the tags matches, the resource is considered a match for the include or exclude. Working with Tag Editor.

ResourceType.description: The type of resource to protect with the policy, either an Application Load Balancer or a CloudFront distribution. This is in the format shown in AWS Resource Types Reference. Valid values are AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer or AWS::CloudFront::Distribution.

Details about the service. This contains WAF data in JSON format, as shown in the following example:

ManagedServiceData": "{\"type\": \"WAF\", \"ruleGroups\": [{\"id\": \"12345678-1bcd-9012-efga-0987654321ab\", \"overrideAction\" : {\"type\": \"COUNT\"}}], \"defaultAction\": {\"type\": \"BLOCK\"}}

Type.description: The service that the policy is using to protect the resources. This value is WAF.

PolicyArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the policy that was created.

Policy.description: The details of the AWS Firewall Manager policy to be created.

ExcludeMap.description:
Specifies the AWS account IDs to exclude from the policy. The IncludeMap values are evaluated first, with all the appropriate account IDs added to the policy. Then the accounts listed in ExcludeMap are removed, resulting in the final list of accounts to add to the policy.

The key to the map is ACCOUNT. For example, a valid ExcludeMap would be {“ACCOUNT” : [“accountID1”, “accountID2”]}.

IncludeMap.description:
Specifies the AWS account IDs to include in the policy. If IncludeMap is null, all accounts in the organization in AWS Organizations are included in the policy. If IncludeMap is not null, only values listed in IncludeMap are included in the policy.

The key to the map is ACCOUNT. For example, a valid IncludeMap would be {“ACCOUNT” : [“accountID1”, “accountID2”]}.

To get the PolicyUpdateToken of the current policy version, use a GetPolicy request.

ComplianceViolator.description: Details of the resource that is not protected by the policy.

ResourceType.description: The resource type. This is in the format shown in AWS Resource Types Reference. Valid values are AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer or AWS::CloudFront::Distribution.

ViolationReason.description: The reason that the resource is not protected by the policy.

PolicyId.description: The ID of the policy that you want to delete. PolicyId is returned by PutPolicy and by ListPolicies.

EvaluationResult.description: Describes the compliance status for the account. An account is considered non-compliant if it includes resources that are not protected by the specified policy.

ComplianceStatus.description: Describes an AWS account's compliance with the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

Tags enable you to categorize your AWS resources in different ways, for example, by purpose, owner, or environment. Each tag consists of a key and an optional value, both of which you define. Tags are combined with an "OR." That is, if you add more than one tag, if any of the tags matches, the resource is considered a match for the include or exclude. Working with Tag Editor.

ResourceType.description: The type of resource to protect with the policy, either an Application Load Balancer or a CloudFront distribution. This is in the format shown in AWS Resource Types Reference. Valid values are AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer or AWS::CloudFront::Distribution.

SecurityServicePolicyData.description: Details about the security service that is being used to protect the resources.

ManagedServiceData.description:
Details about the service. This contains WAF data in JSON format, as shown in the following example:

ManagedServiceData": "{\"type\": \"WAF\", \"ruleGroups\": [{\"id\": \"12345678-1bcd-9012-efga-0987654321ab\", \"overrideAction\" : {\"type\": \"COUNT\"}}], \"defaultAction\": {\"type\": \"BLOCK\"}}

Type.description: The service that the policy is using to protect the resources. This value is WAF.

PolicyComplianceDetail.description: Describes the non-compliant resources in a member account for a specific AWS Firewall Manager policy. A maximum of 100 entries are displayed. If more than 100 resources are non-compliant, EvaluationLimitExceeded is set to True.

EvaluationLimitExceeded.description: Indicates if over 100 resources are non-compliant with the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

ExpiredAt.description: A time stamp that indicates when the returned information should be considered out-of-date.

IssueInfoMap.description: Details about problems with dependent services, such as AWS WAF or AWS Config, that are causing a resource to be non-compliant. The details include the name of the dependent service and the error message received that indicates the problem with the service.

PolicyId.description: The ID of the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

PolicyOwner.description: The AWS account that created the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

Violators.description: An array of resources that are not protected by the policy.

items.description: Details of the resource that is not protected by the policy.

ResourceType.description: The resource type. This is in the format shown in AWS Resource Types Reference. Valid values are AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer or AWS::CloudFront::Distribution.

ViolationReason.description: The reason that the resource is not protected by the policy.

PolicyComplianceStatus.description: Indicates whether the account is compliant with the specified policy. An account is considered non-compliant if it includes resources that are not protected by the policy.

items.description: Describes the compliance status for the account. An account is considered non-compliant if it includes resources that are not protected by the specified policy.

ComplianceStatus.description: Describes an AWS account's compliance with the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

EvaluationLimitExceeded.description: Indicates that over 100 resources are non-compliant with the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

ViolatorCount.description: Number of resources that are non-compliant with the specified policy. A resource is considered non-compliant if it is not associated with the specified policy.

IssueInfoMap.description: Details about problems with dependent services, such as AWS WAF or AWS Config, that are causing a resource to be non-compliant. The details include the name of the dependent service and the error message received that indicates the problem with the service.

LastUpdated.description: Time stamp of the last update to the EvaluationResult objects.

PolicyId.description: The ID of the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

PolicyName.description: The friendly name of the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

PolicyOwner.description: The AWS account that created the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

items.description: Indicates whether the account is compliant with the specified policy. An account is considered non-compliant if it includes resources that are not protected by the policy.
Describes the compliance status for the account. An account is considered non-compliant if it includes resources that are not protected by the specified policy.

ComplianceStatus.description: Describes an AWS account's compliance with the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

EvaluationLimitExceeded.description: Indicates that over 100 resources are non-compliant with the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

ViolatorCount.description: Number of resources that are non-compliant with the specified policy. A resource is considered non-compliant if it is not associated with the specified policy.

IssueInfoMap.description: Details about problems with dependent services, such as AWS WAF or AWS Config, that are causing a resource to be non-compliant. The details include the name of the dependent service and the error message received that indicates the problem with the service.

LastUpdated.description: Time stamp of the last update to the EvaluationResult objects.

PolicyId.description: The ID of the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

PolicyName.description: The friendly name of the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

PolicyOwner.description: The AWS account that created the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

PolicySummary.description: Details of the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

PolicyArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the specified policy.

PolicyId.description: The ID of the specified policy.

PolicyName.description: The friendly name of the specified policy.

RemediationEnabled.description: Indicates if the policy should be automatically applied to new resources.

ResourceType.description: The type of resource to protect with the policy, either an Application Load Balancer or a CloudFront distribution. This is in the format shown in AWS Resource Types Reference. Valid values are AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer or AWS::CloudFront::Distribution.

SecurityServiceType.description: The service that the policy is using to protect the resources. This value is WAF.

items.description: Details of the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

PolicyArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the specified policy.

PolicyId.description: The ID of the specified policy.

PolicyName.description: The friendly name of the specified policy.

RemediationEnabled.description: Indicates if the policy should be automatically applied to new resources.

ResourceType.description: The type of resource to protect with the policy, either an Application Load Balancer or a CloudFront distribution. This is in the format shown in AWS Resource Types Reference. Valid values are AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer or AWS::CloudFront::Distribution.

SecurityServiceType.description: The service that the policy is using to protect the resources. This value is WAF.

SnsRoleName.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that allows Amazon SNS to record AWS Firewall Manager activity.

SnsTopicArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic that collects notifications from AWS Firewall Manager.

Policy.description: The details of the AWS Firewall Manager policy to be created.

ExcludeMap.description:
Specifies the AWS account IDs to exclude from the policy. The IncludeMap values are evaluated first, with all the appropriate account IDs added to the policy. Then the accounts listed in ExcludeMap are removed, resulting in the final list of accounts to add to the policy.

The key to the map is ACCOUNT. For example, a valid ExcludeMap would be {“ACCOUNT” : [“accountID1”, “accountID2”]}.

ExcludeResourceTags.description: If set to True, resources with the tags that are specified in the ResourceTag array are not protected by the policy. If set to False, and the ResourceTag array is not null, only resources with the specified tags are associated with the policy.

IncludeMap.description:
Specifies the AWS account IDs to include in the policy. If IncludeMap is null, all accounts in the organization in AWS Organizations are included in the policy. If IncludeMap is not null, only values listed in IncludeMap are included in the policy.

The key to the map is ACCOUNT. For example, a valid IncludeMap would be {“ACCOUNT” : [“accountID1”, “accountID2”]}.

PolicyId.description: The ID of the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

PolicyName.description: The friendly name of the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

PolicyUpdateToken.description: A unique identifier for each update to the policy. When issuing a PutPolicy request, the PolicyUpdateToken in the request must match the PolicyUpdateToken of the current policy version. To get the PolicyUpdateToken of the current policy version, use a GetPolicy request.

RemediationEnabled.description: Indicates if the policy should be automatically applied to new resources.

items.description: The resource tags that AWS Firewall Manager uses to determine if a particular resource should be included or excluded from protection by the AWS Firewall Manager policy. Tags enable you to categorize your AWS resources in different ways, for example, by purpose, owner, or environment. Each tag consists of a key and an optional value, both of which you define. Tags are combined with an "OR." That is, if you add more than one tag, if any of the tags matches, the resource is considered a match for the include or exclude. Working with Tag Editor.

ResourceType.description: The type of resource to protect with the policy, either an Application Load Balancer or a CloudFront distribution. This is in the format shown in AWS Resource Types Reference. Valid values are AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer or AWS::CloudFront::Distribution.

SecurityServicePolicyData.description: Details about the security service that is being used to protect the resources.

ManagedServiceData.description:
Details about the service. This contains WAF data in JSON format, as shown in the following example:

ManagedServiceData": "{\"type\": \"WAF\", \"ruleGroups\": [{\"id\": \"12345678-1bcd-9012-efga-0987654321ab\", \"overrideAction\" : {\"type\": \"COUNT\"}}], \"defaultAction\": {\"type\": \"BLOCK\"}}

Type.description: The service that the policy is using to protect the resources. This value is WAF.

Policy.description: The details of the AWS Firewall Manager policy that was created.

ExcludeMap.description:
Specifies the AWS account IDs to exclude from the policy. The IncludeMap values are evaluated first, with all the appropriate account IDs added to the policy. Then the accounts listed in ExcludeMap are removed, resulting in the final list of accounts to add to the policy.

The key to the map is ACCOUNT. For example, a valid ExcludeMap would be {“ACCOUNT” : [“accountID1”, “accountID2”]}.

ExcludeResourceTags.description: If set to True, resources with the tags that are specified in the ResourceTag array are not protected by the policy. If set to False, and the ResourceTag array is not null, only resources with the specified tags are associated with the policy.

IncludeMap.description:
Specifies the AWS account IDs to include in the policy. If IncludeMap is null, all accounts in the organization in AWS Organizations are included in the policy. If IncludeMap is not null, only values listed in IncludeMap are included in the policy.

The key to the map is ACCOUNT. For example, a valid IncludeMap would be {“ACCOUNT” : [“accountID1”, “accountID2”]}.

PolicyId.description: The ID of the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

PolicyName.description: The friendly name of the AWS Firewall Manager policy.

PolicyUpdateToken.description: A unique identifier for each update to the policy. When issuing a PutPolicy request, the PolicyUpdateToken in the request must match the PolicyUpdateToken of the current policy version. To get the PolicyUpdateToken of the current policy version, use a GetPolicy request.

RemediationEnabled.description: Indicates if the policy should be automatically applied to new resources.

Tags are combined with an "OR." That is, if you add more than one tag, if any of the tags matches, the resource is considered a match for the include or exclude. Working with Tag Editor.

Type.description: The service that the policy is using to protect the resources. This value is WAF.

PolicyArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the policy that was created.

ResourceTag.description: The resource tags that AWS Firewall Manager uses to determine if a particular resource should be included or excluded from protection by the AWS Firewall Manager policy. Tags enable you to categorize your AWS resources in different ways, for example, by purpose, owner, or environment. Each tag consists of a key and an optional value, both of which you define. Tags are combined with an "OR." That is, if you add more than one tag, if any of the tags matches, the resource is considered a match for the include or exclude. Working with Tag Editor.
